title: ssl error or connection error. certs
content:
Every time I try to connect my domain to my website on solo AI web developer site, I get an ssl or cashe or connection error with a

Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to login.ionos.ca. SSL received a record that exceeded the maximum permissible length.

Error code: SSL_ERROR_RX_RECORD_TOO_LONG 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem.


not sure whats happening? 

please help if you have time,

thanks, Dan Westwood
creator: wildwestdrywall

title: Firefox suddenly can’t open Google documents
content: I previously was able to open up Google Documents but am no longer able to. What can I change in my settings to be able to view Google Documents like before?
creator: vsgjhyt7xz

title: not all windows appear in the drop down "window" menu, and a different number when each window is on top
content:
not all windows appear in the drop down "window" menu, and a different number when each window is on top. Weird.

Using Mac OSX. Nothing is "full screen." Seems to be nothing to do with if a window is minimized or not.

I have restarted. Recently updated, and lost profile, but recovered it, but lost all my open windows & tabs, so now I have only 5 windows open. Seems to be nothing to do with if a window is minimized (OSX) or not. Needs a better mechanism to save open windows & tabs along with profile data.
creator: s1s1s11

title: Hidden ad tabs - Why is this allowed?
content:
I did some research recently on some travel sites.

Today, while trying to research which tab was doing DNS queries to SnapChat (which I never use) I learned about `about:processes`. I found 5 "hidden" tabs from various travel sites (some of which I never visited) running in the background. I did not explicitly hide any tabs.

WHY IS IT ALLOWED FOR SITES TO KEEP OPEN HIDDEN TABS AT ALL WITHOUT TELLING ME ABOUT IT?

This is not conducive to trusting Mozilla.
creator: jhgarrison
